description.en: Fundamental principles of chemical and physical processes, heat and  work, criteria of  spontaneous change, thermodynamical conditions of  chemical equilibrium, phase equilibrium, phase transitions will be discussed. Properties of solutions of electrolytes and nonelectrolytes as well as basic problems of electrochemistry will be analysed. Basic principles of kinetics, adsorption, catalysis and electrochemistry will be discussed .
description.et:
Loengukursustes käsitletakse keemiliste ja füüsikaliste protsesside kõige üldisemaid  seaduspärasusi: soojusefekte ja tööd, protsessi isevoolu kulgemise ja tasakaaluoleku termodünaamilisi tingimusi, faaside tasakaalu ja faasiliste üleminekute seaduspärasusi. Vaadeldakse lahuste  moodustumise tingimusi ja mitteelektrolüütide ning elektrolüüdi lahuste 
omadusi. Käsitletakse ka kineetika alusteooriaid, adsorptsiooni  põhiseaduspärasusi ning katalüüsinähtusi. Antakse algteadmised elektrokeemiliste protsesside kohta.

objectives.en: The main aim of the course is to give basic theoretical knowledge in physical chemistry to understand the thermodynamic and kinetic aspect of chemical processes.
objectives.et: Loeng annab teoreetilise baasi keemiliste protsesside olulisemate termodünaamiliste ja kineetiliste seaduspärasuste mõistmiseks. Käsitleb termodünaamika ja kineetika alusteooriaid, adsorptsiooni põhiseaduspärasusi ning katalüüsinähtusi.

learning_outcomes.et: on omandanud füüsikalise keemia kursuse baasteadmised ja tunneb käsitletud teooriate põhipostulaate ja füüsikalise keemia tagapõhja;

learning_outcomes.en: *can discuss and describe using basic knowledges in physical chemistry;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab füüsikalise keemia baasteadmisi rakendada lahendades ja arutades erinevaid probleemülesandeid;

learning_outcomes.en: *can analyse the influence of various changes on the properties of physical and chemical processes and equilibrium stages;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab analüüsida tingimuste muutmise mõju füüsikaliste ja keemiliste protsesside toimumise seaduspärasustele;

learning_outcomes.en: *can distinguish and relate between different chapters in physical chemistry course;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab tuua ja luua seoseid füüsikalise keemia kursuse erinevate valdkondade vahel;

learning_outcomes.en: *can derive and employ different physical chemistry equations in order to solve practical and theoretical problems;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab tuletada loengus käsitletud füüsikalise keemia seaduspärasusi kirjeldavaid võrrandeid ja oskab neid kasutada erinevate probleemide lahendamisel;

learning_outcomes.en: *independently is able to plan and establish the aim of the practical work;
learning_outcomes.et: oskab lähtuvalt eesmärgile planeerida ja viia läbi eksperimente füüsikalises keemias;

learning_outcomes.en: *is able to report the experimental results in writing form as well as verbally, interpret the results and make conclusions.
learning_outcomes.et: oskab nii kirjalikult kui ka suuliselt esitada eksperimenditulemusi, neid tõlgendada ja teha vastavaid järeldusi.

independent_work.et: All extra assignments are described in Moodle. All the self-tests and group-works give an overall 50 points from the final grade, and the passing level is 80%.

description.et: Home and group-work 50 points (80% is the level of passing).
5 practical works have to be done. Practical work repots are accepted and the results are defended.
First test: Thermodynamics and electrochemistry. 10 points (passing level 6p).
Second test: Phase equilibrium and chemical kinetics. 10 points (passing level 6p).
Final test: all the materials, theoretical principles, and calculation exercises. 30 points (50% under each topic).

grade_preconditions.et: All the tests and laboratory works have to be done before the exam.

grade_evaluation.et:
5 practical works: practical works are done, the reports are accepted and the experimental results are defended (pass or not pass). 

First test: thermodynamics and electrochemistry: 10 points (passing level 6p)
Second test: Phase diagrams and acid-base equilibrium: 10 points (passing level 6p)

Final exam: 30%
The exam is passed successfully if 51% of the maximum score is achieved under every topic.
Final grade: First test + Second test + EXAM + Individual tests and group work = 100% (A)

description.et:
Lecture 1-6.

Thermodynamics.
  Work, heat, and energy
  Expansion work: reversible and non-reversible expansion
  Heat transactions: calorimetric measurements.
  Enthalpy. Standard enthalpy changes. Standard enthalpies of formation. The temperature dependence
  of reaction enthalpies.
Entropy. Entropy changes accompanying specific processes. The Third Law of thermodynamics.
The Helmholtz and Gibbs energies. Standard molar Gibbs energies. Properties of the Gibbs energy.

Chemical equilibrium 
The Gibbs energy minimum. The description of equilibrium. The response of equilibria to changes of temperature

Equilibrium electrochemistry
Half-reactions and electrodes. Varieties of cells. 
The cell potential. Standard electrode potentials. Applications of standard potentials.

First test

Thermodynamics and equlibrium electrochemistry.
Theoretical questions and calculation exercises.

Lecture 7-10

Phase diagrams: Phase diagrams of binary systems. Vapour pressure diagrams Temperature-composition diagrams. Liquid-liquid phase diagrams.

Physical transformation of pure substance: The stabilities of phases. Phase boundaries. Three representative phase. Thermodynamic aspects of phase transitions.

The thermodynamic description of mixtures. The chemical potentials of liquids. Colligative properties. Osmosis in physiology and biochemistry.

Lecture 11-12.

Solutions: 
Strong and weak electrolytes, buffer solutions, hydrolysis.

Lecture 14-16.

Chemical kinetics. 
The rates of reactions. Integrated rate laws. Reactions approaching equilibrium. 
The temperature dependence of reaction rates.
Elementary reactions. Consecutive elementary reactions. Unimolecular reactions.Photochemistry. 

Reaction dynamics.
Collision theory. Diffusion-controlled reactions. The material balance equation. Transition state theory. The dynamics of molecular collisions. 

Catalysis.
Homogeneous catalysis. Features of homogeneous catalysis. Enzymes.
Heterogeneous catalysis. The growth and structure of solid surfaces. The extent of adsorption.  The rates of surface processes. Mechanisms of heterogeneous catalysis. Catalytic activity at surfaces.

Second test:

Phase equilibrium and chemical kinetics. 
Theoretical questions and calculation exercises.

5 (each laboratory work takes five hours) laboratory works starting on the 31st academic week:
Practical work 1: Calorimetric measurements.
Practical work 2: Phase diagram measurements.
Practical work 3: Chemical kinetics of selective reactions.
Practical work 4: Weak electrolyte dissociation constant measurements.
Practical work 5:
(a) Redox titration.
(b) Activity coefficient measurements.
